name: Gunnheim
description: Dish out carnage of hellish proportions in Gunnheim, a top-down co-op shooter where the equation is simple: Vikings + Guns = Mayhem!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or later Processor: AMD A6-4400M APU Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4600 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space Additional Notes: Can be played with a controller or mouse+keyboard

reviews.review_text: Game should still be in early access. Using a controller in the menu only works halfway. (scrolling not possible) Joining games is also only possible with mouse.  Commands get registered only 5-10sec. after pressing the button. --> Game is unplayable Game was developed for coop, but only 2 characters are available in the beginning....  First game I refunded!

This is the makings of a cult classic but there's some things holding it back. Its good fun with a friend and a couple of controllers.  Gunnheim plays a little different than you would expect, basically you have a primary weapon that is generally not good enough to really beat things down with. It'll get you by but you need the special weapon drops. Those special weapon drops tend to have very low ammo so it adds a surprisingly strategic element to the game when you have to decide when is the best time to pull the trigger - because getting it wrong probably means death.  Enemies are distinctly different and you have to deal with them all a little bit differently which adds a lot to the strategy element. Feedback is pretty good too, response from the gameplay is very readable. The 'arcade'-y feel and old school menu art is awesome.  It's super simple yet the skill factor really makes it enjoyable. Most of the significant bugs seems nonexistant but there is plenty of room for polish. Almost every part of the game could use another iteration pass. Animations, hitboxes, AI behavior, level design, etc all need some more attention. A few levels are almost completely pointless because you can just run straight through them with basically no danger. Don't expect Gauntlet style quality level design.  Overall I would say 4/5 for fun and its potential to scale up to something way more awesome pretty quick. Losing points for lack of polish in some areas.

Vikings, with big guns, what more do you want?  This game is a twin stick shooter, cartoony look,and a lot of fun!  You shoot your way to the exit, in several short levels, picking up bigger, more badass guns.   Add me if you want to play Hardmode co-op.

This is one of the most disappointing games on Steam. The theme is cool, but it basically doesn't deliver anything in the fun or graphics departments. I really regret this purchase and wasted too much time to realize that to get a refund. DO NOT BUY
Good game! I've been following it's progress on /r/unity3d. Reminds me of Broforce in a lot of ways. Still playing so more review in coming

The aliased polygons are really painful on the eyes. Also, the game lags a lot, and I don't exactly have a crap PC (GTX 980 G1, i7 3930K @ 4 GHz). Quadrupled the resolution with DSR, the game was still running at about the same speed, which suggests it's most likely a CPU/code issue. The game managed to reboot my computer when going back to the main screen, but who knows, maybe it's just my PC that doesn't like this one game.
This game is laughably dull and uninteresting.
